28DEFC5804A240F4B36577D24B381108.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the role of probability in society

DB15A920473E46C0961CB562A4B3EAB1.description: Develop and implement a project plan for the collection, display and analysis of data by: •formulating a question for investigation •choosing a data collection method that includes social consideration • selecting a population or a sample •collecting the data •displaying the collected data in an appropriate manner •drawing conclusions to answer the question.

FEFEF1AE37794BFBB38730FCE492A322.description: Select and defend the choice of using either a population or a sample of a population to answer a question.

3CB1B8BE4891480FAF593A8A8F71632B.description: Describe the effects of : •bias • uses of language • ethics •cost •time and timing •privacy • cultural sensitivity—on collection of data.

4A85D1D8CDD3487D888752D4D69DFB74.description: USES DATA AND PROBABILITY TO SOLVE PROBLEMS

6D80F28379A44303A3E864BFB6E806DD.description: Demonstrate an understanding of line and rotation symmetry.

82A6D23D96B349FA9E86F3E252B59C3E.description: Draw and interpret scale diagrams of 2-D shapes.

E1E45BB254AD48D6BCAB030F92E31662.description: Demonstrate an understanding of similarity of polygons

69AAE3796A3A48EBB2522F26A2FF6B2F.description: Determine the surface area of composite 3-D objects to solve problems.

C8FDE2A2EA86451093F1EF8043FAF6DE.description: UNDERSTANDS OBJECTS AND SHAPES (CHARACTERISTICS, MOTION, POSITION)

946C5D4272704FADB98B39158511BCCB.description: Solve problems and justify the solution strategy, using the following circle properties: • the perpendicular from the center of a circle to a chord bisects the chord •the measure of the central angle is equal to twice the measure of the inscribed angle subtended by the same arc •the inscribed angles subtended by the sAme arc are congruent • a tangent to a circle is perpendicular to the radius at the point of tangency.

856DC6C2625C407DAB41CB7F349EBC4C.description: Model, record and explain the operations of multiplication and division of polynomial expressions (limited to polynomials of degree less than or equal to 2) by monomials, concretely, pictorially and symbolically.

C46341F920854DB3B37263C60E7B18D0.description: Model, record and explain the operations of addition and subtraction of polynomial expressions, concretely, pictorially and symbolically (limited to polynomials of degree less than or equal to 2).

E7B6C26EE0C44E43A04D860B362871B3.description: Demonstrate an understanding of polynomials (limited to polynomials of degree less than or equal to 2).

FD07625EF75947568B2B8BE951CA7F7F.description: Explain and illustrate strategies to solve single variable linear inequalities with rational coefficients within a problem-solving context.

0EA408B987F646D1988C01702983D6B4.description: Model and solve problems, using linear equations of the form: • ax = b, •x/a = b, a≠0 •ax + b = c •x/a + b = c, a≠0 •ax = b+cx •a(x+b)=c •ax + b = cx +d •a(bx +c) = d (ex + f) •a/x = b, x≠0

E764FAE739FE439EA6D83A2F9FAB2B82.description: USES ALGEBRA TO MODEL AND SOLVE PROBLEMS

D925F0A56D6C49D397FE95F3E1E2ED89.description: Graph a linear relation, analyze the graph, and interpolate or extrapolate to solve problems.

1ADF7E636FBF4D68B1E09BFADDEDA8EA.description: Generalize a pattern arising from a problem-solving context, using a linear equation, and verify by substitution.

29D84FDA38F64E689160375F5592BC47.description: Determine an approximate square root of positive rational numbers that are non-perfect squares.

73D0084ECD904B3EB29E5E2557133862.description: Determine the square root of positive rational numbers that are perfect squares.

9F1027F4B6F643DF85E586A7B0C52C5C.description: Explain and apply the order of operations, including exponents, with and without technology.

52008E09B8354E839D710A00DB7F6A14.description: Demonstrate an understanding of rational numbers by: •comparing and ordering rational numbers •solving problems that involve arithmetic operations on rational numbers.

AD191A249072417A91110A249BA65CCD.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of operations on powers with integral bases (excluding base 0) and whole number exponents: 
• (a^m) (a^n) = a^m+n   •a^m÷a^n= a^m-n, m>n  •(a^m)^n=a^mn  •(ab)^m=a^mb^m  •(a/b)^n = a^n/b^n, b≠0.

5E2893A06B3D499EB255A5876F90669E.description: Demonstrate an understanding of powers with integral bases (excluding base 0) and whole number exponents by: •representing repeated multiplication •using powers •using patterns to show that a power with an exponent of zero is equal to one •solving problems involving powers.
